Section 1.title: Title and extent of operation of the Code
Section 1.description: This Act shall be called the Indian Penal Code and shall extend to the whole of India except the State of Jammu and Kashmir.

Section 2.title: Punishment of offences committed within India
Section 2.description: Every person shall be liable to punishment under this Code for every act or omission contrary to its provisions committed within India.

Section 3.title: Punishment of offences committed beyond, but which by law may be tried within India
Section 3.description: Any person liable under Indian law for an offense committed beyond India shall be dealt with according to this Code as if the offense had been committed within India.

Section 4.title: Extension of Code to extra-territorial offences
Section 4.description: The provisions of this Code apply to offenses committed by (1) any Indian citizen anywhere in the world, and (2) any person on a ship or aircraft registered in India, regardless of location.

Section 5.title: Certain laws not to be affected by this Act
Section 5.description: Nothing in this Act shall affect laws related to mutiny, desertion, or special and local laws.

Section 6.title: Definitions in the Code to be understood subject to exceptions
Section 6.description: Every definition, penal provision, and illustration in this Code shall be understood subject to the exceptions in the 'General Exceptions' chapter.

Section 7.title: Sense of expression once explained
Section 7.description: Any expression explained in one part of this Code shall be used in the same sense throughout the Code.

Section 8.title: Gender
Section 8.description: The pronoun 'he' and its derivatives include both male and female persons.

Section 9.title: Number
Section 9.description: Words importing the singular number include the plural, and vice versa.

Section 10.title: Man, Woman
Section 10.description: Man' denotes a male human being of any age, and 'woman' denotes a female human being of any age.

Section 11.title: Person
Section 11.description: Person' includes any company, association, or body of persons, whether incorporated or not.

Section 12.title: Public
Section 12.description: Public' includes any class of the public or any community.

Section 14.title: Servant of Government
Section 14.description: Servant of Government' includes any officer or employee appointed or employed by the Government.

Section 17.title: Government
Section 17.description: Government' refers to the Central Government or a State Government.

Section 18.title: India
Section 18.description: India' means the territory of India, excluding Jammu and Kashmir.

Section 19.title: Judge
Section 19.description: Judge' denotes a person officially designated as a judge or empowered by law to give judgments in legal proceedings.

Section 20.title: Court of Justice
Section 20.description: Court of Justice' denotes a judge or a body of judges authorized by law to act judicially.

Section 21.title: Public Servant
Section 21.description: Public Servant' includes judges, military officers, police officers, revenue officers, and any other government officials performing public duties.

Section 22.title: Moveable Property
Section 22.description: Moveable Property' includes all corporeal property except land and things permanently attached to it.

Section 23.title: Wrongful Gain
Section 23.description: Wrongful Gain' is gaining property unlawfully. 'Wrongful Loss' is losing property unlawfully.

Section 24.title: Dishonestly
Section 24.description: Dishonestly' refers to doing something with the intention of wrongful gain or wrongful loss.

Section 25.title: Fraudulently
Section 25.description: Fraudulently' refers to doing something with intent to defraud.

Section 26.title: Reason to Believe
Section 26.description: Reason to Believe' exists when a person has sufficient cause to believe something.

Section 27.title: Property in possession of wife, clerk or servant
Section 27.description: Property in the possession of a wife, clerk, or servant on account of another person is deemed to be in that person’s possession.

Section 28.title: Counterfeit
Section 28.description: Counterfeit' means making one thing resemble another with intent to deceive.

Section 29.title: Document
Section 29.description: Document' refers to any matter expressed through letters, figures, or marks, intended for use as evidence.

Section 29A.title: Electronic record
Section 29A.description: Electronic Record' has the meaning assigned to it under the Information Technology Act, 2000.

Section 30.title: Valuable Security
Section 30.description: Valuable Security' is a document that creates, extends, transfers, or extinguishes a legal right.

Section 31.title: A Will
Section 31.description: A Will' refers to any testamentary document.

Section 32.title: Words referring to acts include illegal omissions
Section 32.description: Words referring to acts include illegal omissions.

Section 33.title: Act Omission
Section 33.description: Act' includes both a single act and a series of acts. 'Omission' includes both a single omission and a series of omissions.

Section 34.title: Acts done by several persons in furtherance of common intention
Section 34.description: When a criminal act is done by several persons with a common intention, each person is liable as if they did it alone.

Section 35.title: When such an act is criminal by reason of its being done with a criminal knowledge or intention
Section 35.description: If an act is criminal due to criminal knowledge or intention, each participant with such knowledge or intention is liable.

Section 36.title: Effect caused partly by act and partly by omission
Section 36.description: Causing an effect partly by an act and partly by an omission is considered the same offense.

Section 37.title: Co-operation by doing one of several acts constituting an offence
Section 37.description: A person who intentionally cooperates in an offense by doing any act constituting it is guilty of the offense.

Section 38.title: Persons concerned in criminal act may be guilty of different offences
Section 38.description: Persons involved in a criminal act may be guilty of different offenses.

Section 39.title: Voluntarily
Section 39.description: Voluntarily' means causing an effect intentionally or knowing it is likely to occur.

Section 40.title: Offence
Section 40.description: Offense' refers to any act punishable under this Code or any special or local law.

Section 41.title: Special Law
Section 41.description: A 'Special Law' applies to a particular subject.

Section 42.title: Local Law
Section 42.description: A 'Local Law' applies only to a specific area in India.

Section 43.title: Illegal, Legally bound to do
Section 43.description: Illegal' refers to anything that is an offense, prohibited by law, or grounds for a civil action.

Section 44.title: Injury
Section 44.description: Injury' means harm caused illegally to a person’s body, mind, reputation, or property.

Section 45.title: Life
Section 45.description: Life' denotes human life unless the context suggests otherwise.

Section 46.title: Death
Section 46.description: Death' refers to the death of a human being.

Section 47.title: Animal
Section 47.description: Animal' includes any living creature except humans.

Section 48.title: Vessel
Section 48.description: Vessel' means anything made for water transport of people or property.

Section 49.title: Year, Month
Section 49.description: Year' and 'Month' are calculated according to the British calendar.

Section 50.title: Section
Section 50.description: Section' denotes a numbered portion of a chapter in this Code.

Section 51.title: Oath
Section 51.description: Oath' includes a solemn affirmation or legally required declaration.

Section 52.title: Good faith
Section 52.description: Good Faith' means something is not done in good faith if it is done without due care and attention.

Section 52A.title: Harbour
Section 52A.description: Harbour' means providing shelter, food, money, or other assistance to evade apprehension.

Section 53.title: Punishment
Section 53.description: Punishments under this Code include death, life imprisonment, imprisonment (rigorous or simple), forfeiture of property, and fines.

Section 53A.title: Construction of reference to transportation
Section 53A.description: References to 'transportation for life' shall be interpreted as 'imprisonment for life'.

Section 54.title: Commutation of sentence of death
Section 54.description: The appropriate government may commute a death sentence to any lesser punishment without the offender’s consent.

Section 55.title: Commutation of sentence of imprisonment for life
Section 55.description: The appropriate government may commute a life imprisonment sentence to a term not exceeding 14 years.

Section 55A.title: Definition of appropriate Government
Section 55A.description: Appropriate Government' for commuting sentences is defined based on executive jurisdiction.

Section 56.title: Sentence of Europeans and Americans to penal servitude

Section 57.title: Fractions of terms of punishment
Section 57.description: For calculating fractions of punishments, life imprisonment is considered equivalent to 20 years.

Section 58.title: Offenders sentenced to transportation how dealt with until transported

Section 60.title: Sentence may be (in certain cases of imprisonment) wholly or partly rigorous or simple
Section 60.description: A court may direct that imprisonment be wholly or partially rigorous or simple.

Section 62.title: Forfeiture of property, in respect of offenders punishable with death, transportation or imprisonment

Section 63.title: Amount of fine
Section 63.description: The amount of fine is unlimited unless specified, but must not be excessive.

Section 64.title: Sentence of imprisonment for non-payment of fine
Section 64.description: A sentence may include imprisonment in default of fine payment.

Section 65.title: Limit to imprisonment for non-payment of fine, when imprisonment and fine awardable
Section 65.description: The term of imprisonment for non-payment of fine shall not exceed one-fourth of the maximum sentence for the offense.

Section 66.title: Description of imprisonment for non-payment of fine
Section 66.description: The nature of imprisonment for non-payment of a fine depends on the type of offense.

Section 67.title: Imprisonment for non-payment of fine when offence punishable with fine only
Section 67.description: If an offense is punishable only with a fine, default imprisonment shall be simple.

Section 68.title: Imprisonment to terminate on payment of fine
Section 68.description: Imprisonment for non-payment of fine ends upon payment of the fine.

Section 69.title: Termination of imprisonment on payment of proportional part of fine
Section 69.description: If part of a fine is paid, proportional reduction in imprisonment applies.

Section 70.title: Fine levied within six years, or during imprisonment - Death not to discharge property from liability
Section 70.description: A fine may be recovered within six years or during imprisonment, and liability remains even after death.

Section 71.title: Limit of punishment of offence made up of several offences
Section 71.description: If an offense consists of multiple parts, the offender shall not be punished for more than one unless explicitly stated.

Section 72.title: Punishment of person guilty of one of several offences, the judgment stating that it is doubtful of which
Section 72.description: If a person is convicted of one of multiple offenses, the lowest applicable punishment shall be given.

Section 73.title: Solitary confinement
Section 73.description: Solitary confinement may be imposed for up to three months depending on the term of imprisonment.

Section 74.title: Limit of solitary confinement
Section 74.description: Solitary confinement must not exceed 14 days at a time and must have breaks between periods.

Section 75.title: Enhanced punishment for certain offences under Chapter XII or Chapter XVII after previous conviction
Section 75.description: A person convicted under Chapters XII or XVII with a prior conviction may face enhanced punishment.

Section 76.title: Act done by a person bound, or by mistake of fact believing himself bound, by law
Section 76.description: No offense is committed if an act is done by a person bound by law or who mistakenly believes they are bound by law.

Section 77.title: Act of Judge when acting judicially
Section 77.description: A judge acting judicially under lawful authority commits no offense.

Section 78.title: Act done pursuant to the judgment or order of Court
Section 78.description: Acts done in pursuance of a court order are not offenses.

Section 79.title: Act done by a person justified, or by mistake of fact believing himself justified, by law
Section 79.description: No offense is committed if a person, in good faith, believes they are justified by law in doing an act.

Section 80.title: Accident in doing a lawful act
Section 80.description: No offense is committed if an act is accidental and done lawfully with due caution.

Section 81.title: Act likely to cause harm, but done without criminal intent, and to prevent other harm
Section 81.description: An act done without criminal intent to prevent greater harm is not an offense.

Section 82.title: Act of a child under seven years of age
Section 82.description: A child under seven years of age commits no offense.

Section 83.title: Act of a child above seven and under twelve of immature understanding
Section 83.description: A child between seven and twelve who lacks sufficient maturity to understand the consequences of their act commits no offense.

Section 84.title: Act of a person of unsound mind
Section 84.description: An act done by a person of unsound mind who cannot understand its nature is not an offense.

Section 85.title: Act of a person incapable of judgment by reason of intoxication caused against his will
Section 85.description: An act done in involuntary intoxication is not an offense.

Section 86.title: Offence requiring a particular intent of knowledge committed by one who is intoxicated
Section 86.description: A voluntarily intoxicated person is treated as having normal intent unless intoxicated involuntarily.

Section 87.title: Act not intended and not known to be likely to cause death or grievous hurt, done by consent
Section 87.description: Acts not intended to cause serious harm and done with consent are not offenses.

Section 88.title: Act not intended to cause death, done by consent in good faith for person’s benefit
Section 88.description: Acts done in good faith for another’s benefit with their consent are not offenses.

Section 89.title: Act done in good faith for benefit of child or insane person, by or by consent of guardian
Section 89.description: Acts done in good faith for a child or insane person’s benefit are not offenses, with exceptions.

Section 90.title: Consent known to be given under fear or misconception
Section 90.description: Consent given under fear, misconception, or by an incapable person is invalid.

Section 91.title: Exclusion of acts which are offences independently of harm caused
Section 91.description: Acts that are offenses independently of harm caused are not excused by consent.

Section 92.title: Act done in good faith for benefit of a person without consent
Section 92.description: Acts done in good faith for a person’s benefit without consent may be excused.

Section 93.title: Communication made in good faith
Section 93.description: A communication made in good faith for a person's benefit is not an offense.

Section 94.title: Act to which a person is compelled by threats
Section 94.description: Acts done under threat of instant death, except for murder or offenses against the State, are excused

Section 95.title: Act causing slight harm
Section 95.description: Acts causing slight harm that no reasonable person would complain about are not offenses.

Section 96.title: Things done in private defence
Section 96.description: Acts done in good faith for a person’s benefit Acts done in private defense are not offenses.without consent may be excused.

Section 97.title: Right of private defence of the body and of property
Section 97.description: The right of private defense applies to both body and property.

Section 98.title: Right of private defence against the act of a person of unsound mind, etc.
Section 98.description: The right of private defense applies even against acts by persons lacking legal responsibility.

Section 99.title: Act against which there is no right of private defence
Section 99.description: The right of private defense has restrictions.

Section 100.title: When the right of private defence of the body extends to causing death
Section 100.description: The right of private defense of the body extends to causing death in specific circumstances.

Section 101.title: When such right extends to causing any harm other than death
Section 101.description: If the offense is not among those mentioned in the previous section, the right of private defense does not extend to causing death but allows any harm other than death.

Section 102.title: Commencement and continuance of the right of private defence of the body
Section 102.description: The right of private defense of the body begins as soon as there is a reasonable apprehension of danger and continues as long as such apprehension exists.

Section 103.title: When the right of private defence of property extends to causing death
Section 103.description: The right of private defense of property extends to causing death if the offense involves robbery, house-breaking by night, mischief by fire on a dwelling, or theft causing apprehension of grievous hurt.

Section 104.title: When such right extends to causing any harm other than death
Section 104.description: If the offense does not meet the conditions of the previous section, the right of private defense extends to any harm except death.

Section 105.title: Commencement and continuance of the right of private defence of property
Section 105.description: The right of private defense of property starts when danger is reasonably apprehended and continues until the danger ceases.

Section 106.title: Right of private defence against deadly assault when there is a risk of harm to innocent persons
Section 106.description: If exercising the right of private defense against a deadly assault risks harming an innocent person, the defender is still justified.

Section 107.title: Abetment of a thing
Section 107.description: A person abets an offense if they instigate, conspire, or intentionally aid in its commission.

Section 108.title: Abettor
Section 108.description: A person who abets an offense either directly or indirectly is called an abettor.

Section 108A.title: Abetment in India of offences outside India
Section 108A.description: A person in India abetting an offense outside India is still liable under this Code.

Section 109.title: Punishment of abetment if the act abetted is committed in consequence
Section 109.description: If an act abetted is committed, the abettor is liable to the same punishment unless otherwise specified.

Section 110.title: Punishment of abetment if person abetted does act with different intention
Section 110.description: If the person abetted commits the act with a different intention than the abettor, the punishment is based on what the abettor intended.

Section 111.title: Liability of abettor when one act abetted and a different act done
Section 111.description: If a different act is done than what was abetted, the abettor is liable if the act was a probable consequence of the abetment.

Section 112.title: Abettor when liable to cumulative punishment
Section 112.description: If an abettor is liable for an act done due to abetment, they may receive cumulative punishment for both acts.

Section 113.title: Liability of abettor for an effect different from intended
Section 113.description: If an act abetted causes a different effect than intended, the abettor is liable for the actual effect if they foresaw it.

Section 114.title: Abettor present when offence is committed
Section 114.description: An abettor present at the commission of an offense is treated as if they committed it.

Section 115.title: Abetment of offence punishable with death or life imprisonment—if offence not committed
Section 115.description: If an abettor aids an offense punishable by death or life imprisonment but the offense is not committed, they can be imprisoned for up to 7 years; if harm is caused, up to 14 years.

Section 116.title: Abetment of offence punishable with imprisonment—if offence not committed
Section 116.description: If an abettor aids an offense punishable with imprisonment and the offense is not committed, they can be imprisoned up to one-fourth of the maximum term.

Section 117.title: Abetting commission of offence by the public or by more than ten persons
Section 117.description: Abetting an offense by the public or more than ten persons is punishable by up to 3 years in prison or a fine.

Section 118.title: Concealing design to commit offence punishable with death or life imprisonment
Section 118.description: Concealing a plan to commit an offense punishable with death or life imprisonment is punishable by up to 7 years if the offense occurs, or 3 years if it does not.

Section 119.title: Public servant concealing design to commit an offence which it is his duty to prevent
Section 119.description: A public servant concealing a plan to commit an offense they must prevent faces up to half the punishment for the offense.

Section 120.title: Concealing design to commit an offence punishable with imprisonment
Section 120.description: Concealing a design to commit an offense punishable with imprisonment carries a penalty of up to one-fourth of the longest imprisonment term.

Section 120A.title: Definition of criminal conspiracy
Section 120A.description: Criminal conspiracy is when two or more persons agree to commit an illegal act or a legal act by illegal means.

Section 120B.title: Punishment of criminal conspiracy
Section 120B.description: Punishment for criminal conspiracy depends on the offense conspired; if no specific punishment exists, the punishment is the same as for abetment.

Section 121.title: Waging, or attempting to wage war against the Government of India
Section 121.description: Waging war or attempting to wage war against the Government of India is punishable by death or life imprisonment.

Section 121A.title: Conspiracy to commit offences punishable by Section 121
Section 121A.description: Conspiring to commit offenses under Section 121 carries imprisonment for life or up to 10 years.

Section 122.title: Collecting arms with intent to wage war
Section 122.description: Collecting arms with intent to wage war against the Government of India carries life imprisonment or up to 10 years.

Section 123.title: Concealing design to wage war
Section 123.description: Concealing a plan to wage war against the Government of India is punishable by up to 10 years in prison.

Section 124.title: Assaulting President, Governor, etc., with intent to compel or restrain lawful power
Section 124.description: Assaulting the President or Governor to compel or restrain lawful power is punishable by up to 7 years in prison.

Section 124A.title: Sedition
Section 124A.description: Sedition—bringing hatred, contempt, or disaffection towards the government by words, writing, or visible representation—is punishable with life imprisonment or up to 3 years in prison.

Section 125.title: Waging war against any Asiatic Power in alliance with India
Section 125.description: Waging war against an Asiatic Power allied with India carries life imprisonment or up to 7 years.

Section 126.title: Committing depredation on territories of a Power at peace with India
Section 126.description: Depredation on the territory of a power at peace with India is punishable by up to 7 years in prison.

Section 127.title: Receiving property taken by war or depredation
Section 127.description: Receiving property taken in war or depredation is punishable by up to 7 years in prison.

Section 128.title: Public servant voluntarily allowing a State prisoner or war prisoner to escape
Section 128.description: A public servant voluntarily allowing a state or war prisoner to escape faces life imprisonment or up to 10 years.

Section 129.title: Public servant negligently suffering such a prisoner to escape
Section 129.description: A public servant negligently allowing such a prisoner to escape is punishable by up to 3 years in prison.

Section 130.title: Aiding escape of, rescuing, or harboring such prisoners
Section 130.description: Aiding the escape or harboring such prisoners carries life imprisonment or up to 10 years.

Section 131.title: Abetting mutiny or attempting to seduce a soldier, sailor, or airman from duty
Section 131.description: Abetting mutiny or attempting to seduce a soldier, sailor, or airman from duty is punishable by life imprisonment or up to 10 years.

Section 132.title: Abetment of mutiny, if mutiny is committed
Section 132.description: If mutiny is committed due to abetment, the punishment is death or life imprisonment.

Section 133.title: Abetment of assault by soldier, sailor, or airman on a superior officer
Section 133.description: Abetting an assault by a soldier, sailor, or airman on a superior officer is punishable by up to 3 years.

Section 134.title: Abetment of such assault, if the assault is committed
Section 134.description: If the assault is committed, the abettor faces up to 7 years in prison.

Section 135.title: Abetment of desertion of soldier, sailor, or airman
Section 135.description: Abetting desertion by a soldier, sailor, or airman carries up to 2 years in prison.

Section 136.title: Harbouring deserter
Section 136.description: Harboring a deserter is punishable by up to 2 years in prison.

Section 137.title: Deserter concealed on board merchant vessel through negligence of master
Section 137.description: A master of a merchant vessel who negligently allows a deserter to be concealed is fined up to ₹500.

Section 138.title: Abetment of act of insubordination by soldier, sailor, or airman
Section 138.description: Abetting insubordination by a soldier, sailor, or airman carries up to 6 months in prison.

Section 138A.title: Application of foregoing sections to the Indian Marine Service
Section 138A.description: This section applies to the Indian Marine Service.

Section 139.title: Persons subject to certain Acts not to be punished under this Code
Section 139.description: Persons subject to certain military acts are not punished under this Code.

Section 140.title: Wearing garb or carrying token used by soldier, sailor, or airman
Section 140.description: Wearing military garb or carrying a token of a soldier, sailor, or airman with intent to deceive carries up to 3 months in prison.

Section 141.title: Unlawful assembly
Section 141.description: Unlawful assembly is when five or more persons gather for illegal purposes.

Section 142.title: Being a member of an unlawful assembly
Section 142.description: A person is considered a member of an unlawful assembly if they knowingly join or continue in it.

Section 143.title: Punishment for being a member of an unlawful assembly
Section 143.description: Being a member of an unlawful assembly is punishable by up to 6 months in prison.

Section 144.title: Joining unlawful assembly armed with deadly weapon
Section 144.description: Joining an unlawful assembly armed with a deadly weapon carries up to 2 years in prison.

Section 145.title: Joining or continuing in unlawful assembly knowing it has been commanded to disperse
Section 145.description: Joining or continuing in an unlawful assembly after it has been ordered to disperse is punishable by up to 2 years in prison.

Section 146.title: Rioting
Section 146.description: Rioting involves using force or violence by an unlawful assembly.

Section 147.title: Punishment for rioting
Section 147.description: Rioting is punishable by up to 2 years in prison.

Section 148.title: Rioting, armed with deadly weapon
Section 148.description: Rioting while armed with a deadly weapon carries up to 3 years in prison.

Section 149.title: Every member of unlawful assembly guilty of offence committed in prosecution of common object
Section 149.description: Every member of an unlawful assembly is guilty of any offense committed in furtherance of its common object.

Section 150.title: Hiring or conniving at hiring persons to join unlawful assembly
Section 150.description: Hiring or conniving at hiring persons to join an unlawful assembly is punishable as if they were a member of the assembly.

Section 151.title: Knowingly joining or continuing in an assembly after it has been commanded to disperse
Section 151.description: Knowingly continuing in an unlawful assembly after it has been ordered to disperse is punishable by up to 6 months in prison.

Section 152.title: Assaulting or obstructing public servant when suppressing riot
Section 152.description: Assaulting or obstructing a public servant suppressing a riot is punishable by up to 3 years in prison.

Section 153.title: Wantonly giving provocation with intent to cause riot
Section 153.description: Provoking a riot is punishable by up to 1 year in prison; if a riot does not occur, the term is up to 6 months.

Section 153A.title: 153A. Promoting enmity between different groups on grounds of religion, race, etc.
Section 153A.description: Promoting enmity between groups based on religion, race, or other factors, punishable by up to 3 years in prison (5 years if done in a place of worship)​

Section 153AA.title: 153B. Imputations, assertions prejudicial to national integration
Section 153AA.description: Carrying arms in a procession or public training, violating Section 144A, punishable by up to 6 months in prison and a fine​

Section 153B.title: Punishment for knowingly carrying arms in any procession or organising, or holding or taking part in any mass drill or mass training with arms
Section 153B.description: Making statements against a class of people suggesting they cannot uphold the Constitution, punishable by up to 3 years in prison (5 years if done in a place of worship)​

Section 154.title: Owner or occupier of land on which unlawful assembly is held
Section 154.description: If an unlawful assembly or riot occurs, the owner or occupier of the land where it takes place must notify authorities and take measures to prevent or suppress it. Failure to do so can result in a fine.

Section 155.title: Liability of person for whose benefit riot is committed
Section 155.description: If a riot benefits a person with an interest in the land, and they fail to prevent it, they are liable for a fine.

Section 156.title: Liability of agent of owner or occupier for whose benefit riot is committed
Section 156.description: If an agent of the landowner benefits from a riot and does not take preventive action, they are also liable.

Section 157.title: Harbouring persons hired for an unlawful assembly
Section 157.description: Harboring persons hired for an unlawful assembly is punishable with imprisonment or a fine.

Section 158.title: Being hired to take part in unlawful assembly or riot
Section 158.description: Being hired to participate in an unlawful assembly or riot carries a penalty of imprisonment or a fine.

Section 159.title: Affray
Section 159.description: Affray is when two or more people fight in a public place, disturbing public peace.

Section 160.title: Punishment for committing affray
Section 160.description: Punishment for affray includes imprisonment or a fine.

Section 162.title: Taking gratification in order to influence public servant

Section 163.title: Taking gratification for exercise of personal influence

Section 164.title: Punishment for abetment by public servant of offences defined in Section 162 or 163

Section 165.title: Public servant obtaining valuable thing without consideration

Section 165A.title: Punishment for abetment of offences defined in Section 161 or 165

Section 166.title: Public servant disobeying law, with intent to cause injury
Section 166.description: A public servant disobeying the law with intent to cause injury faces imprisonment, a fine, or both.

Section 166A.title: 166A. Public servant disobeying law, in relation to investigation of offences
Section 166A.description: A public servant failing to record or act on certain serious offenses faces imprisonment and a fine.

Section 166B.title: 166B. Punishment for non-treatment of victim
Section 166B.description: A hospital in charge failing to treat a victim in certain cases faces imprisonment, a fine, or both.

Section 167.title: Public servant framing incorrect document with intent to cause injury
Section 167.description: A public servant who knowingly frames an incorrect document to cause injury faces imprisonment or a fine.

Section 168.title: Public servant unlawfully engaging in trade
Section 168.description: A public servant unlawfully engaging in trade faces imprisonment or a fine.

Section 169.title: Public servant unlawfully buying or bidding for property
Section 169.description: A public servant unlawfully buying or bidding for property faces imprisonment, a fine, and confiscation of the property.

Section 170.title: Personating a public servant
Section 170.description: Personating a public servant carries imprisonment, a fine, or both.

Section 171.title: Wearing garb or carrying token used by public servant with fraudulent intent
Section 171.description: Wearing a uniform or carrying a token used by a public servant with fraudulent intent is punishable with imprisonment, a fine, or both.

Section 171A.title: Definitions for offences against elections
Section 171A.description: Defines terms related to election offenses, including bribery, undue influence, and personation.

Section 171B.title: Bribery
Section 171B.description: Giving or accepting a bribe to influence an election is punishable by imprisonment of up to 1 year, a fine, or both.

Section 171C.title: Undue influence at elections
Section 171C.description: Using coercion, threats, or undue influence to affect a voter’s decision is punishable by imprisonment of up to 1 year, a fine, or both.

Section 171D.title: Personation at elections
Section 171D.description: Fraudulently voting in someone else’s name or impersonating another voter is punishable by imprisonment of up to 1 year, a fine, or both.

Section 171E.title: Punishment for bribery
Section 171E.description: Punishment for bribery in elections includes imprisonment of up to 1 year, a fine, or both. If the bribe is a treat or entertainment, only a fine applies.

Section 171F.title: Punishment for undue influence or personation at election
Section 171F.description: Undue influence or personation at elections is punishable by imprisonment of up to 1 year, a fine, or both.

Section 171G.title: False statement in connection with an election
Section 171G.description: Publishing false statements about a candidate’s character or conduct to influence an election is punishable by a fine.

Section 171H.title: Illegal payments in connection with an election
Section 171H.description: Incurring election expenses beyond the legal limit or failing to report them is punishable by a fine.

Section 171I.title: Failure to keep election accounts
Section 171I.description: Failure to keep proper election accounts as required by law is punishable by a fine.

Section 172.title: Absconding to avoid service of summons or other proceeding
Section 172.description: Absconding to avoid service of a summons or legal process carries a penalty of imprisonment, a fine, or both.

Section 173.title: Preventing service of summons or other proceeding
Section 173.description: Preventing the service of a summons carries the same penalty as Section 172.

Section 174.title: Non-attendance in obedience to summons
Section 174.description: Non-attendance in obedience to a summons carries a fine or imprisonment.

Section 174A.title: Non-appearance in response to a proclamation
Section 174A.description: Non-appearance in response to a proclamation carries imprisonment and a fine.

Section 175.title: Omission to produce document to public servant
Section 175.description: Omission to produce documents to a public servant carries imprisonment or a fine.

Section 176.title: Omission to give notice or information to public servant
Section 176.description: Omission to give notice or information to a public servant carries imprisonment or a fine.

Section 177.title: Furnishing false information
Section 177.description: Furnishing false information to a public servant carries imprisonment, a fine, or both.

Section 178.title: Refusing oath or affirmation when duly required by public servant
Section 178.description: Refusing to take an oath or affirmation when required by a public servant carries imprisonment, a fine, or both.

Section 179.title: Refusing to answer public servant authorized to question
Section 179.description: Refusing to answer a public servant authorized to question carries imprisonment, a fine, or both.

Section 180.title: Refusing to sign statement
Section 180.description: Refusing to sign a statement carries imprisonment, a fine, or both.

Section 181.title: False statement on oath to public servant
Section 181.description: Making a false statement on oath to a public servant carries imprisonment and a fine.

Section 182.title: False information with intent to cause public servant to use lawful power to injury of another person
Section 182.description: Providing false information to a public servant to cause harm to another carries imprisonment, a fine, or both.

Section 183.title: Resistance to lawful apprehension
Section 183.description: Resistance to lawful apprehension carries imprisonment, a fine, or both.

Section 184.title: Obstructing sale of property offered for sale by authority of public servant
Section 184.description: Obstructing the sale of property offered for sale by a public servant carries imprisonment, a fine, or both.

Section 185.title: Illegal purchase or bid for property offered for sale by authority of public servant
Section 185.description: Illegal purchase or bid for property offered for sale by a public servant carries imprisonment, a fine, or both.

Section 186.title: Obstructing public servant in discharge of public functions
Section 186.description: Obstructing a public servant in discharge of public functions carries imprisonment, a fine, or both.

Section 187.title: Omission to assist public servant when bound by law
Section 187.description: Omission to assist a public servant when legally bound to do so carries imprisonment, a fine, or both.

Section 188.title: Disobedience to order duly promulgated by public servant
Section 188.description: Disobedience to an order duly promulgated by a public servant carries imprisonment, a fine, or both.

Section 189.title: Threat of injury to public servant
Section 189.description: Threat of injury to a public servant carries imprisonment, a fine, or both.

Section 190.title: Threat of injury to induce a person to refrain from applying for protection to public servant
Section 190.description: Threat of injury to induce a person to refrain from applying for protection carries imprisonment, a fine, or both.

Section 191.title: Giving false evidence
Section 191.description: Giving false evidence carries imprisonment and a fine.

Section 192.title: Fabricating false evidence
Section 192.description: Fabricating false evidence carries imprisonment and a fine.

Section 193.title: Punishment for false evidence
Section 193.description: Punishment for false evidence includes imprisonment and a fine.

Section 194.title: Giving or fabricating false evidence with intent to procure conviction of capital offence
Section 194.description: Giving or fabricating false evidence with intent to procure conviction of a capital offense is punishable by death or life imprisonment.

Section 195.title: Giving or fabricating false evidence with intent to procure conviction of an offence punishable with life imprisonment
Section 195.description: Giving or fabricating false evidence with intent to procure conviction of an offense punishable with life imprisonment carries a severe punishment.

Section 195A.title: Threatening any person to give false evidence
Section 195A.description: Threatening a person to give false evidence carries imprisonment and a fine.

Section 196.title: Using evidence known to be false
Section 196.description: Using evidence known to be false is punishable with imprisonment or a fine.

Section 197.title: Issuing or signing false certificate
Section 197.description: Issuing or signing a false certificate is punishable with imprisonment or a fine.

Section 198.title: Using as true a certificate known to be false
Section 198.description: Using a certificate as true while knowing it to be false is punishable with imprisonment or a fine.

Section 199.title: False statement made in declaration
Section 199.description: Making a false statement in a declaration legally required as evidence is punishable with imprisonment or a fine.

Section 200.title: Using as true such declaration known to be false
Section 200.description: Using a false declaration as true, knowing it to be false, is punishable with imprisonment or a fine.

Section 201.title: Causing disappearance of evidence of offence, or giving false information to screen offender
Section 201.description: Hiding or destroying evidence to protect an offender is punishable based on the severity of the crime.

Section 202.title: Intentional omission to give information of offence by person bound to inform
Section 202.description: Failing to report a known offense is punishable by imprisonment or fine.

Section 203.title: Giving false information respecting an offence committed
Section 203.description: Providing false information about a committed offense is punishable by imprisonment or fine.

Section 204.title: Destruction of document or electronic record to prevent its production as evidence
Section 204.description: Destroying a document or electronic record to prevent its use as evidence is punishable by imprisonment or fine.

Section 205.title: False personation for purpose of act or proceeding in suit or prosecution
Section 205.description: Falsely assuming another identity for legal proceedings is punishable by imprisonment or fine.

Section 206.title: Fraudulent removal or concealment of property to prevent its seizure as forfeited or in execution
Section 206.description: Hiding or transferring property to avoid legal seizure is punishable by imprisonment or fine.

Section 207.title: Fraudulent claim to property to prevent its seizure as forfeited or in execution
Section 207.description: Fraudulently claiming property to prevent lawful seizure is punishable by imprisonment or fine.

Section 208.title: Fraudulently suffering decree for sum not due
Section 208.description: Allowing a fraudulent decree for an amount not due is punishable by imprisonment or fine.

Section 209.title: Dishonestly making false claim in Court
Section 209.description: Making a false claim in court with intent to deceive is punishable by imprisonment or fine.

Section 210.title: Fraudulently obtaining decree for sum not due
Section 210.description: Fraudulently obtaining a decree for an amount not due is punishable by imprisonment or fine.

Section 211.title: False charge of offence made with intent to injure
Section 211.description: Filing false charges to harm someone is punishable by imprisonment or fine.

Section 212.title: Harbouring offender
Section 212.description: Hiding an offender to prevent their arrest is punishable based on the crime committed.

Section 213.title: Taking gift, etc., to screen an offender from punishment
Section 213.description: Accepting gifts to conceal an offense is punishable by imprisonment or fine.

Section 214.title: Offering gift or restoration of property in consideration of screening offender
Section 214.description: Offering a gift to hide an offense is punishable by imprisonment or fine.

Section 215.title: Taking gift to help to recover stolen property, etc.
Section 215.description: Accepting gifts to help recover stolen property without reporting the offender is punishable by imprisonment or fine.

Section 216.title: Harbouring offender who has escaped from custody or whose apprehension has been ordered
Section 216.description: Hiding a fugitive is punishable based on the severity of their offense.

Section 216A.title: Penalty for harbouring robbers or dacoits
Section 216A.description: Harboring robbers or dacoits is punishable by imprisonment and fine.

Section 216B.title: Definition of “harbour” in sections 212, 216 and 216A
Section 216B.description: "Harbour" refers to providing shelter, food, money, assistance, or any means to evade arrest, as mentioned in Sections 212, 216, and 216A.

Section 217.title: Public servant disobeying direction of law with intent to save person from punishment or property from forfeiture
Section 217.description: A public servant disobeying the law to protect a person or property is punishable by imprisonment or fine.

Section 218.title: Public servant framing incorrect record or writing with intent to save person from punishment or property from forfeiture
Section 218.description: A public servant creating a false record to protect someone is punishable by imprisonment or fine.

Section 219.title: Public servant in judicial proceeding corruptly making report, etc., contrary to law
Section 219.description: A public servant making a false report in a judicial proceeding is punishable by imprisonment or fine.

Section 220.title: Commitment for trial or confinement by person having authority who knows that he is acting contrary to law
Section 220.description: Wrongfully confining or committing a person to trial while knowing it is unlawful is punishable by imprisonment or fine.

Section 221.title: Intentional omission to apprehend on the part of public servant bound to apprehend
Section 221.description: A public servant intentionally failing to arrest a person is punishable by imprisonment or fine.

Section 222.title: Intentional omission to apprehend on the part of public servant bound to apprehend person under sentence or lawfully committed
Section 222.description: A public servant allowing an imprisoned person to escape is punishable by imprisonment or fine.

Section 223.title: Escape from confinement or custody negligently suffered by public servant
Section 223.description: A public servant negligently allowing a prisoner to escape is punishable by imprisonment or fine.

Section 224.title: Resistance or obstruction by a person to his lawful apprehension
Section 224.description: Resisting or escaping from lawful custody is punishable by imprisonment or fine.

Section 225.title: Resistance or obstruction to lawful apprehension of another person
Section 225.description: Resisting or preventing someone’s lawful arrest is punishable by imprisonment or fine.

Section 225A.title: Omission to apprehend, or sufferance of escape, on part of public servant, in cases not otherwise provided for
Section 225A.description: A public servant failing to arrest or allowing escape is punishable by imprisonment or fine.

Section 225B.title: Resistance or obstruction to lawful apprehension, or escape or rescue in cases not otherwise provided for
Section 225B.description: Resisting arrest or escaping custody in unspecified cases is punishable by imprisonment or fine.

Section 227.title: Violation of condition of remission of punishment
Section 227.description: Violating conditions of remission leads to serving the original punishment.

Section 228.title: Intentional insult or interruption to public servant sitting in judicial proceeding
Section 228.description: Insulting or interrupting a public servant during judicial proceedings is punishable by imprisonment or fine.

Section 228A.title: Disclosure of identity of the victim of certain offences etc.
Section 228A.description: Revealing the identity of victims of certain offenses is punishable by imprisonment and fine.

Section 229.title: Personation of a juror or assessor
Section 229.description: Impersonating a juror or assessor is punishable by imprisonment or fine.

Section 229A.title: Failure by person released on bail or bond to appear in Court
Section 229A.description: Failing to appear in court after being released on bail is punishable by imprisonment or fine.

Section 230.title: Coin defined
Section 230.description: Coin is metal issued by a government for use as money.

Section 231.title: Counterfeiting coin
Section 231.description: Counterfeiting coins is punishable by imprisonment and fine.

Section 232.title: Counterfeiting Indian coin
Section 232.description: Counterfeiting Indian coins is punishable by life imprisonment or fine.

Section 233.title: Making or selling instrument for counterfeiting coin
Section 233.description: Making or selling tools for counterfeiting coins is punishable by imprisonment and fine.

Section 234.title: Making or selling instrument for counterfeiting Indian coin
Section 234.description: Making or selling tools for counterfeiting Indian coins is punishable by imprisonment and fine.

Section 235.title: Possession of instrument, or material for the purpose of using the same for counterfeiting coin
Section 235.description: Possessing tools for counterfeiting coins is punishable by imprisonment and fine.

Section 236.title: Abetting in India the counterfeiting out of India of coin
Section 236.description: Aiding counterfeiting of coins outside India is punishable as if done in India.

Section 237.title: Import or export of counterfeit coin
Section 237.description: Importing or exporting counterfeit coins is punishable by imprisonment and fine.

Section 238.title: Import or export of counterfeits of the Indian coin
Section 238.description: Importing or exporting counterfeit Indian coins is punishable by life imprisonment or fine.

Section 239.title: Delivery of coin, possessed with knowledge that it is counterfeit
Section 239.description: Passing counterfeit coins as genuine is punishable by imprisonment and fine.

Section 240.title: Delivery of Indian coin, possessed with knowledge that it is counterfeit
Section 240.description: Passing counterfeit Indian coins as genuine is punishable by imprisonment and fine.

Section 241.title: Delivery of coin as genuine, which, when first possessed, the deliverer did not know to be counterfeit
Section 241.description: Delivering counterfeit coins unknowingly but later discovering their nature is punishable by imprisonment or fine.

Section 242.title: Possession of counterfeit coin by person who knew it to be counterfeit when he became possessed thereof
Section 242.description: Possessing counterfeit coins with fraudulent intent is punishable by imprisonment and fine.

Section 243.title: Possession of Indian coin by person who knew it to be counterfeit when he became possessed thereof
Section 243.description: Possessing counterfeit Indian coins with fraudulent intent is punishable by imprisonment and fine.

Section 244.title: Person employed in mint causing coin to be of different weight or composition from that fixed by law
Section 244.description: A mint employee issuing defective coins is punishable by imprisonment and fine.

Section 245.title: Unlawfully taking coining instrument from mint
Section 245.description: Taking a coining tool from a mint without authority is punishable by imprisonment and fine.

Section 246.title: Fraudulently or dishonestly diminishing weight or altering composition of coin
Section 246.description: Fraudulently reducing the weight or altering the composition of a coin is punishable by imprisonment and fine.

Section 247.title: Fraudulently or dishonestly diminishing weight or altering composition of Indian coin
Section 247.description: Fraudulently altering an Indian coin is punishable by imprisonment and fine.

Section 248.title: Altering appearance of coin with intent that it shall pass as coin of different description
Section 248.description: Changing the appearance of a coin to pass it as a different one is punishable by imprisonment and fine.

Section 249.title: Altering appearance of Indian coin with intent that it shall pass as coin of different description
Section 249.description: Changing the appearance of an Indian coin to pass it as a different one is punishable by imprisonment and fine.

Section 250.title: Delivery of coin, possessed with knowledge that it is altered
Section 250.description: Passing altered coins knowing their condition is punishable by imprisonment and fine.

Section 251.title: Delivery of Indian coin, possessed with knowledge that it is altered
Section 251.description: Passing altered Indian coins knowing their condition is punishable by imprisonment and fine.

Section 252.title: Possession of coin by person who knew it to be altered when he became possessed thereof
Section 252.description: Possessing altered coins with fraudulent intent is punishable by imprisonment and fine.

Section 253.title: Possession of Indian coin by person who knew it to be altered when he became possessed thereof
Section 253.description: Possessing altered Indian coins with fraudulent intent is punishable by imprisonment and fine.

Section 254.title: Delivery of coin as genuine, which, when first possessed, the deliverer did not know to be altered
Section 254.description: Delivering a coin as genuine while not initially knowing it was altered is punishable by imprisonment or fine.

Section 255.title: Counterfeiting Government stamp
Section 255.description: Counterfeiting government stamps is punishable by life imprisonment or fine.

Section 256.title: Having possession of instrument or material for counterfeiting Government stamp
Section 256.description: Possessing tools to counterfeit government stamps is punishable by imprisonment and fine.

Section 257.title: Making or selling instrument for counterfeiting Government stamp
Section 257.description: Making or selling tools for counterfeiting government stamps is punishable by imprisonment and fine.

Section 258.title: Sale of counterfeit Government stamp
Section 258.description: Selling counterfeit government stamps is punishable by imprisonment and fine.

Section 259.title: Having possession of counterfeit Government stamp
Section 259.description: Possessing counterfeit government stamps is punishable by imprisonment and fine.

Section 260.title: Using as genuine a Government stamp known to be counterfeit
Section 260.description: Using a known counterfeit government stamp is punishable by imprisonment and fine.

Section 261.title: Effacing writing from substance bearing Government stamp, or removing from document a stamp used for it, with intent to cause loss
Section 261.description: Removing a stamp from a document or erasing its writing to cause loss is punishable by imprisonment and fine.

Section 262.title: Using Government stamp known to have been before used
Section 262.description: Using a previously used government stamp is punishable by imprisonment and fine.

Section 263.title: Erasure of mark denoting that stamp has been used
Section 263.description: Erasing a stamp's mark to reuse it is punishable by imprisonment and fine.

Section 263A.title: Prohibition of fictitious stamps
Section 263A.description: Using or possessing fictitious stamps is punishable by imprisonment and fine.

Section 264.title: Fraudulent use of false instrument for weighing
Section 264.description: Fraudulently using a false instrument for weighing is punishable by imprisonment and fine.

Section 265.title: Fraudulent use of false weight or measure
Section 265.description: Fraudulently using a false weight or measure is punishable by imprisonment and fine.

Section 266.title: Being in possession of false weight or measure
Section 266.description: Possessing a false weight or measure is punishable by imprisonment and fine.

Section 267.title: Making or selling false weight or measure
Section 267.description: Making or selling a false weight or measure is punishable by imprisonment and fine.

Section 268.title: Public nuisance
Section 268.description: Creating a public nuisance is punishable under general provisions.

Section 269.title: Negligent act likely to spread infection of disease dangerous to life
Section 269.description: Negligent acts spreading infectious diseases are punishable by imprisonment or fine.

Section 270.title: Malignant act likely to spread infection of disease dangerous to life
Section 270.description: Malicious acts spreading infectious diseases are punishable by imprisonment or fine.

Section 271.title: Disobedience to quarantine rule
Section 271.description: Disobeying a quarantine rule is punishable by imprisonment or fine.

Section 272.title: Adulteration of food or drink intended for sale
Section 272.description: Adulterating food or drink for sale is punishable by imprisonment and fine.

Section 273.title: Sale of noxious food or drink
Section 273.description: Selling harmful food or drink is punishable by imprisonment and fine.

Section 274.title: Adulteration of drugs
Section 274.description: Adulterating drugs is punishable by imprisonment and fine.

Section 275.title: Sale of adulterated drugs
Section 275.description: Selling adulterated drugs is punishable by imprisonment and fine.

Section 276.title: Sale of drug as a different drug or preparation
Section 276.description: Selling a drug as another drug is punishable by imprisonment and fine.

Section 277.title: Fouling water of public spring or reservoir
Section 277.description: Polluting a public water source is punishable by imprisonment and fine.

Section 278.title: Making atmosphere noxious to health
Section 278.description: Making the atmosphere harmful to health is punishable by fine.

Section 279.title: Rash driving or riding on a public way
Section 279.description: Rash driving on a public road is punishable by imprisonment or fine.

Section 280.title: Rash navigation of vessel
Section 280.description: Rash navigation of a vessel is punishable by imprisonment or fine.

Section 281.title: Exhibition of false light, mark or buoy
Section 281.description: Exhibiting false lights or signals to mislead vessels is punishable by imprisonment or fine.

Section 282.title: Conveying person by water for hire in unsafe or overloaded vessel
Section 282.description: Transporting people in an unsafe or overloaded vessel is punishable by imprisonment or fine.

Section 283.title: Danger or obstruction in public way or line of navigation
Section 283.description: Creating danger or obstruction in a public way is punishable by fine.

Section 284.title: Negligent conduct with respect to poisonous substance
Section 284.description: Negligently handling poison is punishable by imprisonment or fine.

Section 285.title: Negligent conduct with respect to fire or combustible matter
Section 285.description: Negligently handling fire or combustible materials is punishable by imprisonment or fine.

Section 286.title: Negligent conduct with respect to explosive substance
Section 286.description: Negligently handling explosives is punishable by imprisonment or fine.

Section 287.title: Negligent conduct with respect to machinery
Section 287.description: Negligently handling machinery is punishable by imprisonment or fine.

Section 288.title: Negligent conduct with respect to pulling down or repairing buildings
Section 288.description: Negligently handling construction work is punishable by imprisonment or fine.

Section 289.title: Negligent conduct with respect to animal
Section 289.description: Negligently handling animals is punishable by imprisonment or fine.

Section 290.title: Punishment for public nuisance in cases not otherwise provided for
Section 290.description: Causing a public nuisance is punishable by fine.

Section 291.title: Continuance of nuisance
Section 291.description: Continuing a nuisance after an injunction is punishable by imprisonment or fine.

Section 292.title: Sale, etc., of obscene books, etc.
Section 292.description: Selling or distributing obscene books is punishable by imprisonment and fine.

Section 293.title: Sale, etc., of obscene objects to young persons
Section 293.description: Selling obscene material to minors is punishable by imprisonment and fine.

Section 294.title: Obscene acts and songs
Section 294.description: Performing obscene acts or singing obscene songs in public is punishable by imprisonment or fine.

Section 294A.title: Keeping a lottery office
Section 294A.description: Keeping a lottery office for unauthorized lotteries is punishable by imprisonment of up to 6 months, a fine, or both.

Section 295.title: Injuring or defiling place of worship with intent to insult the religion of any class
Section 295.description: Destroying, damaging, or defiling a place of worship or a sacred object with intent to insult a religion is punishable by imprisonment of up to 2 years, a fine, or both.

Section 295A.title: Deliberate and malicious acts intended to outrage religious feelings of any class by insulting its religion or religious beliefs
Section 295A.description: Deliberate and malicious acts intended to outrage religious feelings by insulting religion or religious beliefs, by words, writing, or any visible representation, are punishable by imprisonment of up to 3 years, a fine, or both.

Section 296.title: Disturbing religious assembly
Section 296.description: Disturbing a religious assembly is punishable by imprisonment or fine.

Section 297.title: Trespassing on burial places, etc.
Section 297.description: Trespassing on burial sites is punishable by imprisonment or fine.

Section 298.title: Uttering, words, etc., with deliberate intent to wound religious feelings
Section 298.description: Insulting religious beliefs intentionally is punishable by imprisonment or fine.

Section 299.title: Culpable homicide
Section 299.description: Culpable homicide involves causing death with intent or knowledge.

Section 300.title: Murder
Section 300.description: Murder is an aggravated form of culpable homicide.

Section 301.title: Culpable homicide by causing death of person other than person whose death was intended
Section 301.description: Causing the death of an unintended victim is still homicide.

Section 302.title: Punishment for murder
Section 302.description: Murder is punishable by death or life imprisonment.

Section 303.title: Punishment for murder by a life convict
Section 303.description: Whoever, being under a sentence of life imprisonment, commits murder, shall be punished with death.

Section 304.title: Punishment for culpable homicide not amounting to murder
Section 304.description: Whoever commits culpable homicide not amounting to murder shall be punished with life imprisonment or imprisonment up to ten years and a fine if the act was done with intent, or imprisonment up to ten years or a fine if done with knowledge but without intent.

Section 304A.title: Causing death by negligence
Section 304A.description: Whoever causes death by a rash or negligent act not amounting to culpable homicide shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years or a fine or both.

Section 304B.title: Dowry death
Section 304B.description: If a woman dies under unnatural circumstances within seven years of marriage and has been subjected to cruelty or harassment related to dowry, her husband or relatives are deemed responsible and punished with imprisonment of seven years to life.

Section 305.title: Abetment of suicide of child or insane person
Section 305.description: Abetting the suicide of a minor, insane, intoxicated, or delirious person shall be punishable with death, life imprisonment, or imprisonment up to ten years with a fine.

Section 306.title: Abetment of suicide
Section 306.description: Abetting suicide is punishable with imprisonment up to ten years and a fine.

Section 307.title: Attempt to murder
Section 307.description: Attempt to murder with intent or knowledge shall be punishable with imprisonment up to ten years and a fine. If hurt is caused, imprisonment for life may be imposed. If attempted by a life convict, the punishment may be death.

Section 308.title: Attempt to commit culpable homicide
Section 308.description: Attempt to commit culpable homicide not amounting to murder is punishable with imprisonment up to three years or fine, and if hurt is caused, imprisonment up to seven years or fine.

Section 309.title: Attempt to commit suicide
Section 309.description: Attempting suicide is punishable with simple imprisonment up to one year or fine or both.

Section 310.title: Thug
Section 310.description: A thug is a person habitually associated with robbery or child-stealing accompanied by murder.

Section 311.title: Punishment for thug
Section 311.description: A thug shall be punished with life imprisonment and a fine.

Section 312.title: Causing miscarriage
Section 312.description: Voluntarily causing miscarriage, unless done in good faith to save the woman’s life, is punishable with imprisonment up to three years or fine or both. If the woman is quick with child, imprisonment may extend to seven years.

Section 313.title: Causing miscarriage without woman’s consent
Section 313.description: Causing miscarriage without a woman’s consent is punishable with life imprisonment or imprisonment up to ten years and a fine.

Section 314.title: Death caused by act done with intent to cause miscarriage
Section 314.description: Causing a woman’s death while attempting miscarriage shall be punished with imprisonment up to ten years and a fine. If done without her consent, imprisonment for life may be imposed.

Section 315.title: Act done with intent to prevent child being born alive or to cause it to die after birth
Section 315.description: An act done before birth intending to prevent the child’s birth or cause its death after birth, unless done to save the mother’s life, is punishable with imprisonment up to ten years or a fine or both.

Section 316.title: Causing death of quick unborn child by act amounting to culpable homicide
Section 316.description: Causing the death of a quick unborn child by an act amounting to culpable homicide is punishable with imprisonment up to ten years and a fine.

Section 317.title: Exposure and abandonment of child under twelve years, by parent or person having care of it
Section 317.description: A parent or guardian exposing or abandoning a child under twelve years with intent to abandon shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years or a fine or both.

Section 318.title: Concealment of birth by secret disposal of dead body
Section 318.description: Secretly disposing of a child’s dead body to conceal its birth is punishable with imprisonment up to two years or a fine or both.

Section 319.title: Hurt
Section 319.description: Causing bodily pain, disease, or infirmity constitutes hurt.

Section 320.title: Grievous hurt
Section 320.description: Certain injuries like emasculation, loss of sight, hearing, limb, joint, or serious bodily pain for over twenty days constitute grievous hurt.

Section 321.title: Voluntarily causing hurt
Section 321.description: Voluntarily causing hurt is knowingly or intentionally causing bodily harm.

Section 322.title: Voluntarily causing grievous hurt
Section 322.description: Voluntarily causing grievous hurt involves intentional or known likelihood of causing serious injury.

Section 323.title: Punishment for voluntarily causing hurt
Section 323.description: Voluntarily causing hurt is punishable with imprisonment up to one year or fine up to Rs. 1000 or both.

Section 324.title: Voluntarily causing hurt by dangerous weapons or means
Section 324.description: Voluntarily causing hurt by dangerous weapons or means is punishable with imprisonment up to three years or a fine or both.

Section 325.title: Punishment for voluntarily causing grievous hurt
Section 325.description: Voluntarily causing grievous hurt is punishable with imprisonment up to seven years and a fine.

Section 326.title: Voluntarily causing grievous hurt by dangerous weapons or means
Section 326.description: Voluntarily causing grievous hurt by dangerous weapons or means is punishable with life imprisonment or imprisonment up to ten years and a fine.

Section 326A.title: Voluntarily causing grievous hurt by use of acid
Section 326A.description: Causing permanent damage, deformity, burns, or disfigurement by acid attack is punishable with imprisonment of ten years to life and a fine.

Section 326B.title: Voluntarily throwing or attempting to throw acid
Section 326B.description: Attempting an acid attack is punishable with imprisonment of five to seven years and a fine.

Section 327.title: Voluntarily causing hurt to extort property or to constrain to an illegal act
Section 327.description: Causing hurt to extort property or constrain to an illegal act is punishable with imprisonment up to ten years and a fine.

Section 328.title: Causing hurt by means of poison, etc., with intent to commit an offence
Section 328.description: Administering poison or harmful substances to cause hurt or facilitate an offense is punishable with imprisonment up to ten years and a fine.

Section 329.title: Voluntarily causing grievous hurt to extort property, or to constrain to an illegal act
Section 329.description: Causing grievous hurt to extort property or constrain to an illegal act is punishable with life imprisonment or imprisonment up to ten years and a fine.

Section 330.title: Voluntarily causing hurt to extort confession, or to compel restoration of property
Section 330.description: Causing hurt to extort confession or compel restoration of property is punishable with imprisonment up to seven years and a fine.

Section 331.title: Voluntarily causing grievous hurt to extort confession, or to compel restoration of property
Section 331.description: Causing grievous hurt to extort confession or compel restoration of property is punishable with imprisonment up to ten years and a fine.

Section 332.title: Voluntarily causing hurt to deter public servant from duty
Section 332.description: Causing hurt to deter a public servant from duty is punishable with imprisonment up to three years or a fine or both.

Section 333.title: Voluntarily causing grievous hurt to deter public servant from duty
Section 333.description: Causing grievous hurt to deter a public servant from duty is punishable with imprisonment up to ten years and a fine.

Section 334.title: Voluntarily causing hurt on provocation
Section 334.description: Causing hurt on provocation is punishable with imprisonment up to one month or a fine up to Rs. 500 or both.

Section 335.title: Voluntarily causing grievous hurt on provocation
Section 335.description: Causing grievous hurt on provocation is punishable with imprisonment up to four years or a fine up to Rs. 2000 or both.

Section 336.title: Act endangering life or personal safety of others
Section 336.description: Doing any act so rashly or negligently as to endanger life or personal safety is punishable with imprisonment up to three months or a fine or both.

Section 337.title: Causing hurt by act endangering life or personal safety of others
Section 337.description: Causing hurt by endangering life or personal safety is punishable with imprisonment up to six months or a fine or both.

Section 338.title: Causing grievous hurt by act endangering life or personal safety of others
Section 338.description: Causing grievous hurt by endangering life or personal safety is punishable with imprisonment up to two years or a fine or both.

Section 339.title: Wrongful restraint
Section 339.description: Wrongful restraint is obstructing someone from moving in a direction they have the right to proceed.

Section 340.title: Wrongful confinement
Section 340.description: Wrongful confinement is wrongfully restraining someone within a circumscribed space.

Section 341.title: Punishment for wrongful restraint
Section 341.description: Wrongful restraint is punishable with imprisonment up to one month or a fine up to Rs. 500 or both.

Section 342.title: Punishment for wrongful confinement
Section 342.description: Wrongful confinement is punishable with imprisonment up to one year or a fine up to Rs. 1000 or both.

Section 343.title: Wrongful confinement for three or more days
Section 343.description: Wrongful confinement for three or more days is punishable with imprisonment up to two years or a fine or both.

Section 344.title: Wrongful confinement for ten or more days
Section 344.description: Wrongful confinement for ten or more days is punishable with imprisonment up to three years and a fine.

Section 345.title: Wrongful confinement of person for whose liberation writ has been issued
Section 345.description: Wrongful confinement of a person for whose release a writ has been issued is punishable with imprisonment up to two years in addition to other punishment.

Section 346.title: Wrongful confinement in secret
Section 346.description: Wrongfully confining a person in secret to prevent their location from being discovered is punishable with imprisonment up to two years in addition to any other punishment for wrongful confinement.

Section 347.title: Wrongful confinement to extort property, or constrain to illegal act
Section 347.description: Wrongfully confining a person to extort property, security, or force them to do something illegal is punishable with imprisonment up to three years and a fine.

Section 348.title: Wrongful confinement to extort confession, or compel restoration of property
Section 348.description: Wrongfully confining a person to extort a confession, information, or to force them to restore property is punishable with imprisonment up to three years and a fine.

Section 349.title: Force
Section 349.description: Force refers to causing motion, change in motion, or cessation of motion to a person or an object they are in contact with, using bodily power, an object, or an animal.

Section 350.title: Criminal force
Section 350.description: Criminal force is intentionally using force on a person without their consent to commit an offense or cause fear, injury, or annoyance.

Section 351.title: Assault
Section 351.description: Assault is any gesture or preparation causing another person to fear immediate criminal force.

Section 352.title: Punishment for assault or criminal force otherwise than on grave provocation
Section 352.description: Assault or criminal force, except in cases of grave provocation, is punishable with imprisonment up to three months, a fine, or both.

Section 353.title: Assault or criminal force to deter public servant from discharge of duty
Section 353.description: Assault or criminal force against a public servant to deter them from duty is punishable with imprisonment up to two years, a fine, or both.

Section 354.title: Assault or criminal force to woman with intent to outrage her modesty
Section 354.description: Assault or criminal force against a woman intending to outrage her modesty is punishable with imprisonment of one to five years and a fine.

Section 354A.title: Sexual harassment and punishment for sexual harassment
Section 354A.description: Sexual harassment, including unwelcome physical contact, sexually explicit acts, or demands for sexual favors, is punishable with imprisonment up to three years or a fine.

Section 354B.title: Assault or use of criminal force to woman with intent to disrobe
Section 354B.description: Assault or use of criminal force to disrobe a woman is punishable with imprisonment of three to seven years and a fine.

Section 354C.title: Voyeurism
Section 354C.description: Voyeurism—watching or capturing images of a woman engaging in private acts without her consent—is punishable with imprisonment from one to three years.

Section 354D.title: Stalking
Section 354D.description: Stalking—repeatedly following or contacting a woman despite disinterest—is punishable with imprisonment up to three years for the first offense and up to five years for a repeat offense.

Section 355.title: Assault or criminal force with intent to dishonour person, otherwise than on grave provocation
Section 355.description: Assault or criminal force with intent to dishonor a person, except on grave provocation, is punishable with imprisonment up to two years, a fine, or both.

Section 356.title: Assault or criminal force in attempt to commit theft of property carried by a person
Section 356.description: Assault or criminal force to commit theft of property carried by a person is punishable with imprisonment up to two years, a fine, or both.

Section 357.title: Assault or criminal force in attempt wrongfully to confine a person
Section 357.description: Assault or criminal force in attempting wrongful confinement is punishable with imprisonment up to one year, a fine up to ₹1,000, or both.

Section 358.title: Assault or criminal force on grave provocation
Section 358.description: Assault or criminal force on grave provocation is punishable with simple imprisonment up to one month, a fine up to ₹200, or both.

Section 359.title: Kidnapping
Section 359.description: Kidnapping is of two types—kidnapping from India and kidnapping from lawful guardianship.

Section 360.title: Kidnapping from India
Section 360.description: Taking a person beyond the limits of India without consent is considered kidnapping from India.

Section 361.title: Kidnapping from lawful guardianship
Section 361.description: Taking or enticing a minor (under 16 for males, 18 for females) or a person of unsound mind from lawful guardianship without consent is kidnapping.

Section 362.title: Abduction
Section 362.description: Abduction means using force or deceit to make a person go from one place to another.

Section 363.title: Punishment for kidnapping
Section 363.description: Kidnapping from India or lawful guardianship is punishable with imprisonment up to seven years and a fine.

Section 363A.title: Kidnapping or maiming a minor for purposes of begging
Section 363A.description: Kidnapping or maiming a minor for begging is punishable with imprisonment up to ten years and a fine; maiming for begging is punishable with life imprisonment.

Section 364.title: Kidnapping or abducting in order to murder
Section 364.description: Kidnapping or abducting with intent to murder is punishable with life imprisonment or up to ten years of rigorous imprisonment and a fine.

Section 364A.title: Kidnapping for ransom, etc.
Section 364A.description: Kidnapping for ransom or to force the government, foreign state, or an individual to act is punishable with death or life imprisonment and a fine.

Section 365.title: Kidnapping or abducting with intent secretly and wrongfully to confine person
Section 365.description: Kidnapping or abducting to wrongfully confine a person is punishable with imprisonment up to seven years and a fine.

Section 366.title: Kidnapping, abducting or inducing woman to compel her marriage, etc.
Section 366.description: Kidnapping, abducting, or inducing a woman to compel her marriage or force illicit intercourse is punishable with imprisonment up to ten years and a fine.

Section 366A.title: Procuration of minor girl
Section 366A.description: Inducing a minor girl under 18 for illicit intercourse is punishable with imprisonment up to ten years and a fine.
