Section 366B.title: Importation of girl from foreign country
Section 366B.description: Importing a girl under 21 into India for illicit intercourse is punishable with imprisonment up to ten years and a fine.

Section 367.title: Kidnapping or abducting in order to subject person to grievous hurt, slavery, etc.
Section 367.description: Kidnapping or abducting to subject someone to grievous hurt, slavery, or unnatural lust is punishable with imprisonment up to ten years and a fine.

Section 368.title: Wrongfully concealing or keeping in confinement, kidnapped or abducted person
Section 368.description: Wrongfully concealing or keeping a kidnapped or abducted person is punishable as if the person had committed the kidnapping or abduction.

Section 369.title: Kidnapping or abducting child under ten years with intent to steal from its person
Section 369.description: Kidnapping or abducting a child under ten years with intent to steal from them is punishable with imprisonment up to seven years and a fine.

Section 370.title: Trafficking of persons
Section 370.description: Trafficking persons for exploitation using threats, force, fraud, or abuse of power is punishable with imprisonment from seven years to life and a fine.

Section 370A.title: Exploitation of a trafficked person
Section 370A.description: Engaging a trafficked minor in sexual exploitation is punishable with imprisonment from five to seven years and a fine.

Section 371.title: Habitual dealing in slaves
Section 371.description: Habitual dealing in slaves is punishable with life imprisonment or imprisonment up to ten years and a fine.

Section 372.title: Selling minor for purposes of prostitution, etc.
Section 372.description: Selling a minor for prostitution or other immoral purposes is punishable with imprisonment up to ten years and a fine.

Section 373.title: Buying minor for purposes of prostitution, etc.
Section 373.description: Buying a minor for prostitution or immoral purposes is punishable with imprisonment up to ten years and a fine.

Section 374.title: Unlawful compulsory labour
Section 374.description: Unlawfully compelling a person to labor against their will is punishable with imprisonment up to one year, a fine, or both.

Section 375.title: Rape
Section 375.description: Defines rape, including various forms of sexual penetration against a woman’s consent.

Section 376.title: Punishment for rape
Section 376.description: Rape is punishable with rigorous imprisonment of at least seven years, extending to life imprisonment, and a fine.

Section 376A.title: Punishment for causing death or resulting in persistent vegetative state of victim
Section 376A.description: Causing the victim’s death or a vegetative state during rape is punishable with at least twenty years of imprisonment, life imprisonment, or death.

Section 376AB.title: Punishment for rape of a woman under twelve years of age
Section 376AB.description: Rape of a woman under 12 years is punishable with life imprisonment or death.

Section 376B.title: Sexual intercourse by husband upon his wife during separation
Section 376B.description: Sexual intercourse with a wife during separation without her consent is punishable with imprisonment from two to seven years and a fine.

Section 376C.title: Sexual intercourse by a person in authority
Section 376C.description: Sexual intercourse by a person in authority abusing their position is punishable with imprisonment from five to ten years and a fine.

Section 376D.title: Gang rape
Section 376D.description: Gang rape is punishable with imprisonment of at least twenty years, extending to life imprisonment, and a fine.

Section 376DA.title: Gang rape of a woman under sixteen years of age
Section 376DA.description: Gang rape of a woman under 16 is punishable with life imprisonment.

Section 376DB.title: Gang rape of a woman under twelve years of age
Section 376DB.description: Gang rape of a woman under 12 is punishable with life imprisonment or death.

Section 376E.title: Punishment for repeat offenders
Section 376E.description: Repeat rape offenders are punishable with life imprisonment or death.

Section 377.title: Unnatural offences
Section 377.description: Unnatural offenses (carnal intercourse against the order of nature) are punishable with life imprisonment or imprisonment up to ten years and a fine.

Section 378.title: Theft
Section 378.description: Theft is dishonestly taking movable property out of a person’s possession without consent.

Section 379.title: Punishment for theft
Section 379.description: Theft is punishable with imprisonment up to three years, a fine, or both.

Section 380.title: Theft in dwelling house, etc.
Section 380.description: Theft in a dwelling house or place for property custody is punishable with imprisonment up to seven years and a fine.

Section 381.title: Theft by clerk or servant of property in possession of master
Section 381.description: Theft by a clerk or servant from their employer is punishable with imprisonment up to seven years and a fine.

Section 382.title: Theft after preparation made for causing death, hurt or restraint
Section 382.description: Theft after preparation to cause death, hurt, or restraint is punishable with imprisonment up to ten years and a fine.

Section 383.title: Extortion
Section 383.description: Extortion is putting a person in fear of injury to obtain property or valuables.

Section 384.title: Punishment for extortion
Section 384.description: Extortion is punishable with imprisonment up to three years, a fine, or both.

Section 385.title: Putting person in fear of injury in order to commit extortion
Section 385.description: Attempting extortion by putting a person in fear of injury is punishable with imprisonment up to two years, a fine, or both.

Section 386.title: Extortion by putting a person in fear of death or grievous hurt
Section 386.description: Extortion by putting a person in fear of death or grievous hurt is punishable with imprisonment up to ten years and a fine.

Section 387.title: Putting a person in fear of death or grievous hurt in order to commit extortion
Section 387.description: Attempting extortion by putting a person in fear of death or grievous hurt is punishable with imprisonment up to seven years and a fine.

Section 388.title: Extortion by threat of accusation of an offence punishable with death or life imprisonment
Section 388.description: Extortion by threatening an accusation of an offense punishable with death or life imprisonment is punishable with imprisonment up to ten years and a fine.

Section 389.title: Putting a person in fear of accusation of an offence to commit extortion
Section 389.description: Attempting extortion by threatening an accusation of an offense punishable with death or life imprisonment is punishable with imprisonment up to ten years and a fine.

Section 390.title: Robbery
Section 390.description: Theft or extortion becomes robbery if the offender voluntarily causes or attempts to cause death, hurt, or wrongful restraint.

Section 391.title: Dacoity
Section 391.description: When five or more persons commit or attempt to commit robbery, it is called dacoity.

Section 392.title: Punishment for robbery
Section 392.description: Robbery is punishable with imprisonment up to ten years and a fine (or fourteen years if committed on a highway at night).

Section 393.title: Attempt to commit robbery
Section 393.description: Attempt to commit robbery is punishable with imprisonment up to seven years and a fine.

Section 394.title: Voluntarily causing hurt in committing robbery
Section 394.description: Causing hurt during robbery is punishable with life imprisonment or imprisonment up to ten years and a fine.

Section 395.title: Punishment for dacoity
Section 395.description: Dacoity is punishable with life imprisonment or up to ten years of rigorous imprisonment and a fine.

Section 396.title: Dacoity with murder
Section 396.description: Dacoity with murder is punishable with death, life imprisonment, or imprisonment up to ten years and a fine.

Section 397.title: Robbery or dacoity, with attempt to cause death or grievous hurt
Section 397.description: Robbery or dacoity using a deadly weapon is punishable with at least seven years of imprisonment.

Section 398.title: Attempt to commit robbery or dacoity when armed with deadly weapon
Section 398.description: Attempting robbery or dacoity while armed is punishable with at least seven years of imprisonment.

Section 399.title: Making preparation to commit dacoity
Section 399.description: Making preparations for dacoity is punishable with imprisonment up to ten years and a fine.

Section 400.title: Belonging to gang of dacoits
Section 400.description: Belonging to a gang of dacoits is punishable with life imprisonment or imprisonment up to ten years and a fine.

Section 401.title: Punishment for belonging to gang of thieves
Section 401.description: Belonging to a gang of thieves is punishable with imprisonment up to seven years and a fine.

Section 402.title: Assembling for purpose of committing dacoity
Section 402.description: Assembling for the purpose of committing dacoity is punishable with imprisonment up to seven years and a fine.

Section 403.title: Dishonest misappropriation of property
Section 403.description: Dishonest misappropriation of property is punishable with imprisonment up to two years, a fine, or both.

Section 404.title: Dishonest misappropriation of property possessed by deceased person at the time of his death
Section 404.description: Dishonest misappropriation of property possessed by a deceased person at the time of their death is punishable with imprisonment up to three years, a fine, or both.

Section 405.title: Criminal breach of trust
Section 405.description: Dishonest misappropriation or conversion of entrusted property for personal use or violation of any legal contract regarding its use.

Section 406.title: Punishment for criminal breach of trust
Section 406.description: Criminal breach of trust is punishable with imprisonment up to three years, a fine, or both.

Section 407.title: Criminal breach of trust by carrier, wharfinger, etc.
Section 407.description: Criminal breach of trust by a carrier, wharfinger, or warehouse-keeper is punishable with imprisonment up to seven years and a fine.

Section 408.title: Criminal breach of trust by clerk or servant
Section 408.description: Criminal breach of trust by a clerk or servant is punishable with imprisonment up to seven years and a fine.

Section 409.title: Criminal breach of trust by public servant, banker, merchant, or agent
Section 409.description: Criminal breach of trust by a public servant, banker, merchant, or agent is punishable with life imprisonment or imprisonment up to ten years and a fine.

Section 410.title: Stolen property
Section 410.description: Defines stolen property as any property obtained by theft, extortion, or criminal misappropriation.

Section 411.title: Dishonestly receiving stolen property
Section 411.description: Dishonestly receiving stolen property is punishable with imprisonment up to three years, a fine, or both.

Section 412.title: Dishonestly receiving property stolen in the commission of a dacoity
Section 412.description: Dishonestly receiving property stolen in the commission of a dacoity is punishable with life imprisonment or imprisonment up to ten years and a fine.

Section 413.title: Habitually dealing in stolen property
Section 413.description: Habitually dealing in stolen property is punishable with imprisonment up to ten years and a fine.

Section 414.title: Assisting in concealment of stolen property
Section 414.description: Assisting in concealing stolen property is punishable with imprisonment up to three years, a fine, or both.

Section 415.title: Cheating
Section 415.description: Cheating is fraudulently inducing a person to deliver property or act in a way that causes harm.

Section 416.title: Cheating by personation
Section 416.description: Cheating by personation is pretending to be another person to deceive someone.

Section 417.title: Punishment for cheating
Section 417.description: Cheating is punishable with imprisonment up to one year, a fine, or both.

Section 418.title: Cheating with knowledge that wrongful loss may ensue to a person whose interest the offender is bound to protect
Section 418.description: Cheating with knowledge that wrongful loss may result to someone whose interest the offender is bound to protect is punishable with imprisonment up to three years, a fine, or both.

Section 419.title: Punishment for cheating by personation
Section 419.description: Cheating by personation is punishable with imprisonment up to three years, a fine, or both.

Section 420.title: Cheating and dishonestly inducing delivery of property
Section 420.description: Cheating and dishonestly inducing delivery of property is punishable with imprisonment up to seven years and a fine.

Section 421.title: Dishonest or fraudulent removal or concealment of property to prevent distribution among creditors
Section 421.description: Dishonest removal or concealment of property to prevent distribution among creditors is punishable with imprisonment up to two years, a fine, or both.

Section 422.title: Dishonestly or fraudulently preventing debt being available for creditors
Section 422.description: Fraudulently preventing debts from being available to creditors is punishable with imprisonment up to two years, a fine, or both.

Section 423.title: Dishonest or fraudulent execution of deed of transfer containing false statement of consideration
Section 423.description: Fraudulently executing a deed of transfer with false consideration is punishable with imprisonment up to two years, a fine, or both.

Section 424.title: Dishonest or fraudulent removal or concealment of property
Section 424.description: Fraudulent removal or concealment of property is punishable with imprisonment up to two years, a fine, or both.

Section 425.title: Mischief
Section 425.description: Mischief is causing wrongful loss or damage to property with intent or knowledge.

Section 426.title: Punishment for mischief
Section 426.description: Mischief is punishable with imprisonment up to three months, a fine, or both.

Section 427.title: Mischief causing damage to the amount of fifty rupees
Section 427.description: Mischief causing damage of Rs. 50 or more is punishable with imprisonment up to two years, a fine, or both.

Section 428.title: Mischief by killing or maiming animal of the value of ten rupees
Section 428.description: Mischief by killing or maiming an animal valued at Rs. 10 or more is punishable with imprisonment up to two years, a fine, or both.

Section 429.title: Mischief by killing or maiming cattle, etc., of any value or any animal of the value of fifty rupees
Section 429.description: Mischief by killing or maiming cattle or animals worth Rs. 50 or more is punishable with imprisonment up to five years, a fine, or both.

Section 430.title: Mischief by causing diminution of supply of water for agricultural or other purposes
Section 430.description: Mischief by causing disruption to the supply of water for agricultural or other purposes is punishable with imprisonment up to five years, a fine, or both.

Section 431.title: Mischief by injury to public road, bridge, river, or navigable channel
Section 431.description: Mischief by damaging public roads, bridges, rivers, or navigation channels is punishable with imprisonment up to five years, a fine, or both.

Section 432.title: Mischief by causing inundation or obstruction to public drainage attended with damage
Section 432.description: Mischief by causing flooding or obstructing public drainage is punishable with imprisonment up to five years, a fine, or both.

Section 433.title: Mischief by destroying, moving, or rendering less useful a lighthouse or sea-mark
Section 433.description: Mischief by destroying, moving, or rendering a lighthouse useless is punishable with imprisonment up to seven years and a fine.

Section 434.title: Mischief by destroying or moving landmark fixed by public authority
Section 434.description: Mischief by destroying or moving a landmark fixed by a public authority is punishable with imprisonment up to one year, a fine, or both.

Section 435.title: Mischief by fire or explosive substance with intent to cause damage to property
Section 435.description: Mischief by fire or explosives causing property damage over Rs. 100 is punishable with imprisonment up to seven years and a fine.

Section 436.title: Mischief by fire or explosive substance with intent to destroy house, etc.
Section 436.description: Mischief by fire or explosives with intent to destroy a house, place of worship, or public property is punishable with life imprisonment or up to ten years and a fine.

Section 437.title: Mischief with intent to destroy or make unsafe a decked vessel or one of twenty tons burden
Section 437.description: Mischief with intent to destroy or render a vessel unsafe is punishable with imprisonment up to ten years and a fine.

Section 438.title: Punishment for mischief described in Section 437 committed by fire or explosive substance
Section 438.description: Mischief described in Section 437 committed by fire or explosives is punishable with life imprisonment or up to ten years and a fine.

Section 439.title: Punishment for intentionally running vessel aground, or abandoning it, intending to cause damage
Section 439.description: Intentionally running a vessel aground or abandoning it to cause damage is punishable with imprisonment up to ten years and a fine.

Section 440.title: Mischief committed after preparation made for causing death or hurt
Section 440.description: Mischief committed after preparation to cause death or hurt is punishable with imprisonment up to five years, a fine, or both.

Section 441.title: Criminal trespass
Section 441.description: Criminal trespass is unlawfully entering or remaining on someone's property with intent to commit an offense or cause annoyance.

Section 442.title: House-trespass
Section 442.description: House-trespass is criminal trespass into a building, tent, or vessel used as a dwelling or place of worship.

Section 443.title: Lurking house-trespass
Section 443.description: Lurking house-trespass is house-trespass where the offender conceals their presence.

Section 444.title: Lurking house-trespass by night
Section 444.description: Lurking house-trespass by night is committed between sunset and sunrise while concealing presence.

Section 445.title: Housebreaking
Section 445.description: Housebreaking is house-trespass using force, threats, or deception.

Section 446.title: Housebreaking by night
Section 446.description: Housebreaking by night is committed between sunset and sunrise.

Section 447.title: Punishment for criminal trespass
Section 447.description: Criminal trespass is punishable with imprisonment up to three months, a fine up to Rs. 500, or both.

Section 448.title: Punishment for house-trespass
Section 448.description: House-trespass is punishable with imprisonment up to one year, a fine up to Rs. 1000, or both.

Section 449.title: House-trespass to commit offence punishable with death
Section 449.description: House-trespass to commit an offense punishable with death is punishable with life imprisonment or up to ten years and a fine.

Section 450.title: House-trespass in order to commit an offence punishable with imprisonment for life
Section 450.description: House-trespass to commit an offense punishable with life imprisonment is punishable with up to ten years and a fine.

Section 451.title: House-trespass to commit offence punishable with imprisonment
Section 451.description: House-trespass to commit an offense punishable with imprisonment is punishable with up to two years and a fine.

Section 452.title: House-trespass after preparation for hurt, assault, or wrongful restraint
Section 452.description: House-trespass after preparation to cause hurt, assault, or wrongful restraint is punishable with up to seven years and a fine.

Section 453.title: Punishment for lurking house-trespass or housebreaking
Section 453.description: Lurking house-trespass or housebreaking is punishable with up to three years and a fine.

Section 454.title: Lurking house-trespass or housebreaking in order to commit offence punishable with imprisonment
Section 454.description: Lurking house-trespass or housebreaking to commit an offense punishable with imprisonment is punishable with up to ten years and a fine.

Section 455.title: Lurking house-trespass or housebreaking after preparation for hurt, assault, or wrongful restraint
Section 455.description: Lurking house-trespass or housebreaking after preparation to cause hurt, assault, or wrongful restraint is punishable with up to ten years and a fine.

Section 456.title: Punishment for lurking house-trespass or housebreaking by night
Section 456.description: Lurking house-trespass or housebreaking by night is punishable with up to three years and a fine.

Section 457.title: Lurking house-trespass or housebreaking by night in order to commit an offence punishable with imprisonment
Section 457.description: Lurking house-trespass or housebreaking by night to commit an offense punishable with imprisonment is punishable with up to fourteen years and a fine.

Section 458.title: Lurking house-trespass or housebreaking by night after preparation for hurt, assault, or wrongful restraint
Section 458.description: Lurking house-trespass or housebreaking by night after preparation to cause hurt, assault, or wrongful restraint is punishable with up to fourteen years and a fine.

Section 459.title: Grievous hurt caused while committing lurking house-trespass or housebreaking
Section 459.description: Causing grievous hurt while committing lurking house-trespass or housebreaking is punishable with life imprisonment or up to ten years and a fine.

Section 460.title: Death caused while committing lurking house-trespass or housebreaking
Section 460.description: Causing death while committing lurking house-trespass or housebreaking is punishable with life imprisonment or up to ten years and a fine.

Section 461.title: Dishonestly breaking open receptacle containing property
Section 461.description: Dishonestly breaking open a receptacle containing property is punishable with up to two years and a fine. 462: A person entrusted with property breaking open a receptacle is punishable with up to three years and a fine.

Section 462.title: Punishment for person entrusted with property breaking open receptacle
Section 462.description: A person entrusted with property breaking open a receptacle is punishable with up to three years and a fine.

Section 463.title: Forgery
Section 463.description: Forgery is making a false document with intent to cause damage or commit fraud.

Section 464.title: Making a false document
Section 464.description: Making a false document includes signing someone else’s name without authorization or altering a valid document.

Section 465.title: Punishment for forgery
Section 465.description: Forgery is punishable with imprisonment up to two years, a fine, or both.

Section 466.title: Forgery of record of Court or of public register, etc.
Section 466.description: Forgery of court records or public registers is punishable with up to seven years and a fine.

Section 467.title: Forgery of valuable security, will, etc.
Section 467.description: Forgery of valuable security, will, or authority to transfer property is punishable with life imprisonment or up to ten years and a fine.

Section 468.title: Forgery for purpose of cheating
Section 468.description: Forgery for cheating purposes is punishable with up to seven years and a fine.

Section 469.title: Forgery for purpose of harming reputation
Section 469.description: Forgery for harming someone's reputation is punishable with up to three years and a fine.

Section 470.title: Forged document
Section 470.description: A forged document is one that has been fraudulently altered or created.

Section 471.title: Using as genuine a forged document
Section 471.description: Using a forged document as genuine is punishable as if the person forged it.

Section 472.title: Making or possessing counterfeit seal, etc., with intent to commit forgery
Section 472.description: Making or possessing counterfeit seals or instruments for forgery is punishable with up to seven years and a fine.

Section 473.title: Making or possessing counterfeit seal, etc., with intent to commit forgery punishable otherwise
Section 473.description: Making or possessing counterfeit seals or instruments for forgery of valuable securities is punishable with up to ten years and a fine.

Section 474.title: Possessing a document knowing it to be forged, with intent to use it as genuine
Section 474.description: Possessing a forged document with intent to use it as genuine is punishable with up to seven years and a fine.

Section 475.title: Counterfeiting a device or mark used for authenticating documents described in Section 467
Section 475.description: Counterfeiting a device or mark used to authenticate documents described in Section 467 is punishable with up to ten years and a fine.

Section 476.title: Counterfeiting a device or mark used for authenticating documents described in Section 468
Section 476.description: Counterfeiting a device or mark used to authenticate documents described in Section 468 is punishable with up to seven years and a fine.

Section 477.title: Fraudulent cancellation, destruction, etc., of will, authority to adopt, or valuable security
Section 477.description: Fraudulently canceling, destroying, or altering wills, securities, or adoption authorities is punishable with up to seven years and a fine.

Section 477A.title: Falsification of accounts
Section 477A.description: Falsification of accounts by a clerk, servant, or officer is punishable with up to seven years and a fine.

Section 478.title: Trade mark
Section 478.description: Defines trademarks. A mark used for distinguishing goods manufactured or sold by a specific person.

Section 479.title: Property mark
Section 479.description: Defines property marks. A mark used to denote ownership of movable property.

Section 480.title: Using a false trade mark
Section 480.description: Using a false trademark is punishable with imprisonment up to one year, a fine, or both.

Section 481.title: Using a false property mark
Section 481.description: Using a false property mark is punishable with imprisonment up to one year, a fine, or both.

Section 482.title: Punishment for using a false trade mark or property mark
Section 482.description: Punishment for using a false trademark or property mark is up to two years of imprisonment, a fine, or both.

Section 483.title: Counterfeiting a trade mark or property mark used by another
Section 483.description: Counterfeiting a trademark or property mark used by another is punishable with up to two years, a fine, or both.

Section 484.title: Counterfeiting a mark used by a public servant
Section 484.description: Counterfeiting a mark used by a public servant is punishable with up to three years and a fine.

Section 485.title: Making or possessing an instrument for counterfeiting a trade mark or property mark
Section 485.description: Making or possessing instruments for counterfeiting a trademark or property mark is punishable with up to three years and a fine.

Section 486.title: Selling goods marked with a counterfeit trade mark or property mark
Section 486.description: Selling goods with counterfeit trademarks or property marks is punishable with up to one year, a fine, or both.

Section 487.title: Making a false mark upon any receptacle containing goods
Section 487.description: Making a false mark on a receptacle containing goods is punishable with up to one year, a fine, or both.

Section 488.title: Punishment for making use of any false mark
Section 488.description: Punishment for using a false mark is up to one year of imprisonment, a fine, or both.

Section 489.title: Tampering with property mark with intent to cause injury
Section 489.description: Tampering with a property mark with intent to cause injury is punishable with up to one year, a fine, or both.

Section 489A.title: Counterfeiting currency notes or banknotes
Section 489A.description: Counterfeiting currency notes or banknotes is punishable with life imprisonment or up to ten years and a fine.

Section 489B.title: Using as genuine, forged or counterfeit currency notes or banknotes
Section 489B.description: Using counterfeit currency notes as genuine is punishable with up to ten years and a fine.

Section 489C.title: Possession of forged or counterfeit currency notes or banknotes
Section 489C.description: Possessing counterfeit currency notes is punishable with up to seven years and a fine.

Section 489D.title: Making or possessing instruments or materials for forging currency notes or banknotes
Section 489D.description: Making or possessing instruments or materials for counterfeiting currency notes is punishable with up to ten years and a fine.

Section 489E.title: Making or using documents resembling currency notes or banknotes
Section 489E.description: Making or using documents resembling currency notes or banknotes is punishable with up to seven years and a fine.

Section 490.title: Breach of contract of service during voyage or journey
Section 490.description: Breach of contract of service during a voyage or journey is punishable with imprisonment or a fine.

Section 491.title: Breach of contract to attend on and supply wants of helpless person
Section 491.description: Breach of contract to attend and supply the needs of a helpless person is punishable with imprisonment or a fine.

Section 492.title: Breach of contract to serve at distant place to which servant is conveyed at master’s expense
Section 492.description: Breach of contract to serve at a distant place to which a servant is conveyed at the master’s expense is punishable with imprisonment or a fine.

Section 493.title: Cohabitation caused by a man deceitfully inducing a belief of lawful marriage
Section 493.description: A man deceitfully inducing a woman to cohabit under the false belief of lawful marriage is punishable with imprisonment up to ten years and a fine.

Section 494.title: Marrying again during lifetime of husband or wife
Section 494.description: Marrying again while having a spouse alive is punishable with imprisonment up to seven years and a fine.

Section 495.title: Same offence with concealment of former marriage from person with whom subsequent marriage is contracted
Section 495.description: Marrying again while concealing the existence of a previous marriage is punishable with imprisonment up to ten years and a fine.

Section 496.title: Marriage ceremony fraudulently gone through without lawful marriage
Section 496.description: Fraudulently going through a marriage ceremony without lawful marriage is punishable with imprisonment up to seven years and a fine.

Section 497.title: Adultery
Section 497.description: Adultery was previously punishable with imprisonment up to five years and a fine.

Section 498.title: Enticing or taking away or detaining with criminal intent a married woman
Section 498.description: Enticing or detaining a married woman with criminal intent was previously punishable with imprisonment up to two years and a fine.

Section 498A.title: Husband or relative of husband of a woman subjecting her to cruelty
Section 498A.description: Cruelty by a husband or his relatives toward a woman is punishable with imprisonment up to three years and a fine.

Section 499.title: Defamation
Section 499.description: Defamation includes making or publishing false statements that harm a person’s reputation.

Section 500.title: Punishment for defamation
Section 500.description: Defamation is punishable with imprisonment up to two years, a fine, or both.

Section 501.title: Printing or engraving matter known to be defamatory
Section 501.description: Printing or engraving defamatory material knowing it to be false is punishable with imprisonment up to two years, a fine, or both.

Section 502.title: Sale of printed or engraved substance containing defamatory matter
Section 502.description: Selling printed or engraved defamatory material is punishable with imprisonment up to two years, a fine, or both.

Section 503.title: Criminal intimidation
Section 503.description: Criminal intimidation is threatening injury to a person or property to cause fear or force an action.

Section 504.title: Intentional insult with intent to provoke breach of the peace
Section 504.description: Intentional insult meant to provoke a breach of the peace is punishable with imprisonment up to two years, a fine, or both.

Section 505.title: Statements conducing to public mischief
Section 505.description: Making statements to cause public mischief or hatred between communities is punishable with imprisonment up to three years, a fine, or both.

Section 506.title: Punishment for criminal intimidation
Section 506.description: Criminal intimidation is punishable with imprisonment up to two years, a fine, or both. If the threat is to cause death or grievous hurt, imprisonment may extend to seven years.

Section 507.title: Criminal intimidation by anonymous communication
Section 507.description: Criminal intimidation by anonymous communication is punishable with imprisonment up to two years, in addition to the punishment under Section 506.

Section 508.title: Act caused by inducing person to believe that he will be rendered an object of divine displeasure
Section 508.description: Inducing a person to do something by making them believe they will face divine displeasure if they refuse is punishable with imprisonment up to one year, a fine, or both.

Section 509.title: Word, gesture or act intended to insult the modesty of a woman
Section 509.description: Using words, gestures, or acts intended to insult a woman's modesty is punishable with imprisonment up to three years and a fine.

Section 510.title: Misconduct in public by a drunken person
Section 510.description: Misconduct by a drunken person in public is punishable with imprisonment up to 24 hours or a fine of Rs. 10 or both.

Section 511.title: Punishment for attempting to commit offences
Section 511.description: Attempting to commit an offense punishable with life imprisonment or a lengthy prison term shall be punished with half the term of imprisonment prescribed for the offense or a fine, or both.
